```markdown
# node-fetch

A light-weight module that brings `window.fetch` to Node.js.

[![npm version](https://flat.badgen.net/npm/v/node-fetch)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-fetch)
[![build status](https://flat.badgen.net/travis/bitinn/node-fetch)](https://travis-ci.org/bitinn/node-fetch)
[![coverage status](https://flat.badgen.net/codecov/c/github/bitinn/node-fetch/master)](https://codecov.io/gh/bitinn/node-fetch)
[![install size](https://flat.badgen.net/packagephobia/install/node-fetch)](https://packagephobia.now.sh/result?p=node-fetch)
[![Discord](https://img.shields.io/discord/619915844268326952?color=%237289DA&label=Discord&style=flat-square)](https://discord.gg/Zxbndcm)

Looking for v2 maintainers and collaborators!  [Open an issue](https://github.com/bitinn/node-fetch/issues/567)

[![Backers][opencollective-image]](https://opencollective.com/node-fetch)

**Motivation:**

Instead of using `XMLHttpRequest` in Node.js, `node-fetch` directly implements the `fetch` API, providing a familiar and consistent way to make HTTP requests.

**Features:**

- **Compatibility:**  Fully compatible with the `window.fetch` API.
- **Stream Support:**  Leverages native Node.js streams for request and response bodies.
- **Content Encoding:** Properly decodes gzip/deflate content encoding.
- **Promise Support:** Uses native Promises (can be overridden for other promise libraries).
- **Error Handling:** Explicit error handling for network and operational issues. (See `ERROR-HANDLING.md`)
- **Extensions:** Adds features like timeout, redirect limits, and response size limits. (See `LIMITS.md`)
- **Headers Handling:** Supports headers similar to `window.fetch`

**Differences from client-side fetch:**

See `LIMITS.md` for detailed information on differences between `node-fetch` and client-side `fetch` implementations.


**Installation:**

```bash
npm install node-fetch
```


**Loading and Configuration:**

Load the module via `require`.

```javascript
const fetch = require('node-fetch');
```

To use a different promise library:

```javascript
const Bluebird = require('bluebird');
fetch.Promise = Bluebird;
```

**Common Usage:**

**Plain text or HTML:**

```javascript
fetch('https://github.com/')
  .then(res => res.text())
  .then(body => console.log(body));
```

**JSON:**

```javascript
fetch('https://api.github.com/users/github')
  .then(res => res.json())
  .then(json => console.log(json));
```

**Simple POST:**

```javascript
fetch('https://httpbin.org/post', { method: 'POST', body: 'a=1' })
  .then(res => res.json())
  .then(json => console.log(json));
```

(More examples in the original README, covering JSON POST, form data, error handling, streams, and advanced usage.)


**Advanced Usage (Examples):**

* **Streams:** Downloading a file to disk:
```javascript
const fs = require('fs');
fetch('https://example.com/file.zip')
  .then(res => {
    const writer = fs.createWriteStream('downloaded_file.zip');
    res.body.pipe(writer);
  });
```
* **Buffers:** Retrieving a file as a buffer:
```javascript
fetch('https://example.com/image.png')
  .then(res => res.buffer())
  .then(buffer => {
    // Use the buffer
  });
```
* **Error Handling:** Handling potential errors:
```javascript
fetch('https://example.com/api/error')
  .then(res => {
    if (!res.ok) {
      throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${res.status}`);
    }
    return res.json();
  })
  .then(data => console.log(data))
  .catch(error => console.error("Error:", error));
```



**API Reference:**

Detailed API documentation (classes, methods, etc.) is included in the original README.
